name: Cookham Wetland and Wildlife Trial, Maidenhead

ai.summary: A 12.8 km moderate hike through the wetlands around Maidenhead on the Cookham Wetland and Wildlife Trail. The route features boardwalks over waterlogged areas, grassy paths, and abundant birdlife, offering rewarding wildlife viewing for nature lovers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat with a mix of boardwalks over wetland, gravel and grassy paths, and occasional muddy stretches. Expect uneven surfaces and some short slopes; boardwalks can be damp or slippery after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and potential flooding before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress for variable UK weather. Stay on marked paths; some sections are on boardwalks or muddy trails where surfaces can be slippery when wet. Bring water, sun protection, and insect repellent; carry a map or GPS and a phone with emergency numbers. Keep dogs on leash where required and watch for wildlife. Be mindful of ticks in long grass. Inform someone of your route and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn (Winter can be muddy and less favorable).

seo.title: Cookham Wetland and Wildlife Trail – 12.8 km Hike near Maidenhead, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Cookham Wetland and Wildlife Trail, a 12.8 km moderate hike near Maidenhead. Boardwalks, wetlands and abundant wildlife make it a great year‑round choice.
seo.h1: Cookham Wetland and Wildlife Trail – Maidenhead
